intro: Lysimachia huitsunae, commonly known as the Huitsun yellow myrtle, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, delicate leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers, which bloom in the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
